Now we have heard and it is very commonly reported that there hath been in your nation a king of wonderful holiness, called Oswald‚ the excellency of whose faith and virtue, yea, after death, hath become well known by the performance of many mighty works: and I beseeeh you, if you have any of his relies in your keeping, to bring it to me, in case it may be so that the Lord will be pleased to have mercy upon me through his merits.' VVhereupon I made answer: ⁶ Forsooth, I have some of the tree whereupon his head was stuck after that he was slain of the pay- nims; and if thou wilt believe steadfastly in thine heart, the merciful goodness of God by the merits of so worthy a person can both grant thee longer time to lead this life and also make thee a meet man to enter into the life evei-lasting.' And he answered me incontinent that he did perfectly believe so.

“ Then I blessed water, and casting in a chip of the foresaid oak-wood did give to the sick man to drink. And forthwith he did begin to amend and recovering his health from that sickness lived a long time after: and being turned to God in all heart and deed, did publicly declare to all men, wherever he came, the graciousness of our merciful Maker and the glory of His faithful servant.”
